title: 12k-Mile 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 6-Speed
description: This 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 is finished in Chalk over Black leather and Alcantara with Red accents and is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked with a six-speed manual transaxle with PTV. Equipment includes the Sport Chrono and Light Design packages as well as carbon-fiber-backed bucket seats, a front-axle lift system, a rear spoiler, a Bose sound system, Satin Black 20" center-lock wheels, aluminum pedals, and LED headlights with PDLS+. The seller acquired the car in 2018 and has since added approximately 10k of the 12k indicated miles. This 991.2 GT3 is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean Florida title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 12k-Mile 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #190,185.
text: This 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 is finished in Chalk over Black leather and Alcantara with Red accents and is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked with a six-speed manual transaxle with PTV. Equipment includes the Sport Chrono and Light Design packages as well as carbon-fiber-backed bucket seats, a front-axle lift system, a rear spoiler, a Bose sound system, Satin Black 20″ center-lock wheels, aluminum pedals, and LED headlights with PDLS+. The seller acquired the car in 2018 and has since added approximately 10k of the 12k indicated miles. This 991.2 GT3 is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name. The 991 GT3 featured revised front and rear bumper covers when compared to the standard Carrera as well as a rear wing and dual center-exit exhaust pipes. This example is finished in Chalk with High-Gloss Black door handles and is equipped with LED headlights in Black with the Porsche Dynamic Lighting System Plus (PDLS+). Clear paint protection film covers multiple panels. The photos were taken in August 2024, approximately 200 miles ago. Satin Black-finished 20″ center-lock alloy wheels were mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires in April 2024. The car is equipped with a front-axle lift system, and braking is handled by red Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated discs. The carbon-fiber-backed full bucket seats are trimmed in Black leather and Alcantara with Porsche crest headrest accents as well as Red stripes and stitching. Color-coordinated leather, Alcantara, and stitching adorn the dashboard, center console, and door panels, and further appointments comprise aluminum pedals, a Bose surround-sound system, cruise control, the Light Design Package, illuminated carbon-fiber door sill guards, and PCM with navigation. A fire extinguisher is mounted in the passenger footwell. The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features a Red centering stripe and frames a central GT3-branded tachometer, a 225-mph speedometer, an LCD screen, and auxiliary gauges. The optional Sport Chrono Package added a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 12k miles, approximately 10k of which were added under current ownership. The 4.0-liter flat-six was factory rated at 500 horsepower and 339 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with Porsche Torque Vectoring (PTV). The car was optioned with an extended range 23.7-gallon fuel tank. The seller tells us that the serpentine belt was replaced in 2023, and the battery and Porsche Active Drivetrain Mount (PADM) modules were replaced in 2024. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. Your real-time updates could not be connected. html:
This 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 is finished in Chalk over Black leather and Alcantara with Red accents and is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked with a six-speed manual transaxle with PTV. Equipment includes the Sport Chrono and Light Design packages as well as carbon-fiber-backed bucket seats, a front-axle lift system, a rear spoiler, a Bose sound system, Satin Black 20″ center-lock wheels, aluminum pedals, and LED headlights with PDLS+. The seller acquired the car in 2018 and has since added approximately 10k of the 12k indicated miles. This 991.2 GT3 is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The 991 GT3 featured revised front and rear bumper covers when compared to the standard Carrera as well as a rear wing and dual center-exit exhaust pipes. This example is finished in Chalk with High-Gloss Black door handles and is equipped with LED headlights in Black with the Porsche Dynamic Lighting System Plus (PDLS+). Clear paint protection film covers multiple panels.

The photos were taken in August 2024, approximately 200 miles ago.

Satin Black-finished 20″ center-lock alloy wheels were mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires in April 2024. The car is equipped with a front-axle lift system, and braking is handled by red Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated discs.

The carbon-fiber-backed full bucket seats are trimmed in Black leather and Alcantara with Porsche crest headrest accents as well as Red stripes and stitching. Color-coordinated leather, Alcantara, and stitching adorn the dashboard, center console, and door panels, and further appointments comprise aluminum pedals, a Bose surround-sound system, cruise control, the Light Design Package, illuminated carbon-fiber door sill guards, and PCM with navigation. A fire extinguisher is mounted in the passenger footwell.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features a Red centering stripe and frames a central GT3-branded tachometer, a 225-mph speedometer, an LCD screen, and auxiliary gauges. The optional Sport Chrono Package added a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 12k miles, approximately 10k of which were added under current ownership.

The 4.0-liter flat-six was factory rated at 500 horsepower and 339 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with Porsche Torque Vectoring (PTV). The car was optioned with an extended range 23.7-gallon fuel tank. The seller tells us that the serpentine belt was replaced in 2023, and the battery and Porsche Active Drivetrain Mount (PADM) modules were replaced in 2024.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
